::Prowler::

::Prowler stops firing and comes out of cloaking mode::This can't be 
good... I don't trust the alliance to stop...


--- In nbwrpg@egroups.com, Yanshosh@a... wrote:
> First of: Dcoburn and Logo, the battle is at least a thousand miles 
away, its 
> not right next to the CF, so don't go out and drag HotRod away in 
one post or 
> anything.
> 
> ::The Oblitercons/Firearm/Proto/Prowl::
> 
> Breakdown ducked as he saw Necromancer opens fire, two shots
passing 
over his 
> head. He laughed, stumbling back as a third shot hits him in the 
chest.
> 
> The Oblitercon growled, transforming into his HUMVEE mode and 
driving at 
> Necromancer, firing.
> ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
> Koj's shot hit the outside of Pyro's cannon, leaving a dent in it. 
The 
> Alliance member yelled in rage, scorching the forest while trying
to 
hit Koj 
> with his flames.
> ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
> Scavanger yelled as a blade went halfway through his cannon. He 
jumped back, 
> transforming into bot mode and landing a few feet from the Maximal 
femm.
> 
> Taking a rocket launcher out of subspace, the bot fired it at 
Tavatron, 
> aiming for her feet.
> ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
> Dark One and Firearm hovered a few dozen feet away from each other, 
both of 
> them having their weapons ready. The Alliance bot watched his 
opponent 
> carefully, waiting for him to make the first mode.
> 
> Firearm growled, his weapons ready as well. He glanced quickly at 
the ground, 
> seeing the seperate scirmishes beneath.
> 
> "How about a deal?" Firearm said, loudly enough for Dark One to 
hear. It was 
> obvious to him that this bot had some authority, and he could see a 
way to 
> limit the bloodshed, "We fight right now. Just me and you. If I
win, 
you 
> leave these Maximals alone, if you win, we'll leave."
> 
> Dark One considered the offer carefully, looking over the bigger
bot 
in front 
> of him. He was positive that he could take him. He had, after all, 
taken on 
> much bigger bots before. "Agreed." he said, activating his comm as 
he nods, 
> sending a transmission to all the Oblitercons.
> 
> "Hold your fire," the transmission read, "Me and the Maximal 
commander here," 
> he figured Firearm was the highest ranking Maximal, since he was
the 
one that 
> offered the duel, "Are going to fight one on one. Untill then,
there 
will be 
> no further fighting, understood?"
> 
> He looked back at Firearm, nodding. "I'm ready, Maximal."
> 
> Firearm grinned. "Maximals," he said into his comm, "I'm gonna take 
their 
> leader on a one-on-one. Whoever wins will be the winning faction of 
this 
> battle. It'll help limit the bloodshed. Hold your fire untill then, 
guys. 
> This'll be over shortly."
> 
> Firearm turned back to Dark One, his sword ready. "Well, shall we?"
> 
> Dark One laughed, firing a plasma rifle into the Maximal's chest. 
The two 
> bots flew toward each other, their swords clashing when they met...
> ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
> The Oblitercons stopped firing as they got the transmision, holding 
their 
> fire. Each one looked at their Maximal opponent, ready to fight in 
case the 
> Maximals didn't follow the agreement.
> ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
> Proto's eyes widened as he recieved Firearm's transmission, the 
Maximal 
> flying back a bit to give the two enemies space for battles.
> 
> He hoped that Firearm knew what he was doing, a dead Maximal was
not 
the 
> greatest thing in the world to get out of this mission.
> ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
> Prowl recieved Firearm's orders as he flew into the battle,
frowning 
as his 
> computer reports the message to him. A duel?
> 
> Prowl shook his head, hovering in the air a few dozen feet behind 
the two 
> duelers. He wouldn't have trusted the Alliance with a one on one 
duel, but 
> perhaps it was possible...
> 
> Prowl glanced at the ground, hoping that the Maximals would hold 
their fire.
